com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.proxy
Class LockInteractionEvent

java.lang.Object
  com.google.web.bindery.event.shared.Event<H>
      com.google.gwt.event.shared.GwtEvent<LockInteractionHandler>
          com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.proxy.LockInteractionEvent

public class LockInteractionEvent
extends GwtEvent<LockInteractionHandler>

This event is fired whenever interaction should be locked throughout the application, usually because a navigation operation is taking place and interacting could cause unexpected state switches.

This event is typically fired by the PlaceManager whenever a navigation operation starts or stops. It is handled by the default RootPresenter implementation. Override com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.RootPresenter#lockInteraction(boolean) to customize the behaviour.

Author:
Philippe Beaudoin

LockInteractionEvent

Method Detail

fire

public static void fire(HasHandlers source,
                        boolean lock)
Fires a LockInteractionEvent into a source that has access to an EventBus specifying whether interaction should be locked or unlocked.

Parameters:
source - The source that fires this event (HasHandlers).
lock - true to lock interaction, false to unlock it.
